adobe.WebServer

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • adobe.WebServer.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Server class initializes the different aspects to start a server such as home path, thread pool information and keep alive time
    Author:
    rtalwar

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Server()
      Makes a server object with default values of port(6666), home directory = "DefaultHome", core pool size(3) and max pool size(50) and keep alive time (5000 milliseconds).
      Server(int port)
      Makes a server object with default values of home directory, core pool size and max pool size and keep alive time
      Server(int port, java.lang.String uploadDir)
      Makes a server object
      Server(java.lang.String homePath, int port)
      Makes a server object
      Server(java.lang.String homePath, int port, int corePoolSize, int maxPoolSize, long keepAliveTime, int backlog, int maxRequestLength, java.lang.String faviconName, java.lang.String uploadPath)
      Makes a server object with values as specified
      Server(java.lang.String homePath, int port, java.lang.String uploadDir)
      Makes a server object

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createPostPortal()
      Creates a static HTML page in the home directory to help upload files to the server's upload directory using the browser
      int getBacklog()
      the maximum number of connections waiting in the queue maintained by the operating system
      int getCorePoolSize()
      the number of threads that will be always running at the backend
      ServerFavicon getFavicon() 
      java.lang.String getHomePath()
      Get the home directory path
      long getKeepAliveTime()
      The maximum time a thread is allowed to wait or sit idle
      int getMaxPoolSize()
      The maximum number of threads the backend can start
      int getPort()
      the port to which the server is bound to
      int getReqLength()
      gets the maximum length in number of bytes that can be allowed in the headers of a request
      java.io.File getRootDir()
      The root directory that is served by the server if it exists (gets instantiated only when the server starts running) maybe different from the root directory supplied by the config file
      java.lang.Boolean getServerAccepts()
      tests whether the server is running or not
      java.lang.String getUploadPath()
      gets the upload directory name
      boolean setBacklog(java.lang.String backlog)
      sets the number of connections that can be queued up if the server socket is busy Not to be kept a number greater than 100 - as it is a OS defined queue
      boolean setCorePoolSize(java.lang.String corePoolSize)
      All changes to pool size must be done before starting the server
      void setFavicon(ServerFavicon favicon) 
      boolean setHomePath(java.lang.String homePath)
      Sets the homepath and replaces the OS specific path separators with OS agnostic path separators
      boolean setKeepAliveTime(java.lang.String keepAliveTime)
      All changes to keep alive time must be done before starting the server
      boolean setMaxPoolSize(java.lang.String maxPoolSize)
      All changes to pool size must be done before starting the server
      boolean setPort(java.lang.String strPort)
      sets the port to which the server is to be bound to
      boolean setReqLength(java.lang.String reqLength)
      sets the maximum length in number of bytes that can be allowed in the headers of a request
      void setRootDir(java.io.File rootDir)
      sets the root directory to the File object supplied and if the directory cannot be executed/read upon the default root("DefaultHome") is served
      void setServerAccepts(boolean serverAccepts)
      Sets the server to an accepting state
      boolean setUploadPath(java.lang.String uploadPath)
      Checks the validity of the supplied upload directory and initializes the upload directory variable to default upload path is the suplied value is not a directory
      void startServer()
      Method binds to the specified port number at the localhost serves the directory provided in the homeDir and initiates the backend with the provided 'numThreads' number of threads with the server socket with the timeout value as specified
      void stopServer()
      Stops the server threads and the removes the connections from the connection pool

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(java.lang.String homePath,
      int port,
      int corePoolSize,
      int maxPoolSize,
      long keepAliveTime,
      int backlog,
      int maxRequestLength,
      java.lang.String faviconName,
      java.lang.String uploadPath)
        Makes a server object with values as specified
        Parameters:
        port - : port number to bind the server to
        corePoolSize - : the minimum number of threads to be always kept active
        homePath - : the home directory to be served
        maxPoolSize - : the maximum number of threads that can be allowed to run
        keepAliveTime - : the keep alive time for every thread
        backlog - : the backlog number of connections that can be queued up on the server socket
        faviconName - : the name of the favicon associated with this server
        uploadPath - : The directory where all uploaded files will reside in

      • Server

        public Server(int port,
      java.lang.String uploadDir)
        Makes a server object
        Parameters:
        port - the port number to bind to
        uploadDir - the directory where uploaded files will reside

      java.lang.String uploadDir)
        Makes a server object
        Parameters:
        homePath - : the home directory to be served
        port - : value of port number to bind the server to
        uploadDir - : the directory where uploaded files will reside

      int port)
        Makes a server object

        port - : value of port number to bind the server to

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
        Makes a server object with default values of home directory, core pool size and max pool size and keep alive time
        Parameters:
        port - : : value of port number to bind the server to

      • Server

        public Server()
        Makes a server object with default values of port(6666), home directory = "DefaultHome", core pool size(3) and max pool size(50) and keep alive time (5000 milliseconds).

    • Method Detail

      • getFavicon

        public ServerFavicon getFavicon()
        Returns:
        the server favicon object associated with this server -- created only when the server is started

      • setFavicon

        public void setFavicon(ServerFavicon favicon)
        Parameters:
        favicon - : new favicon object

      • getBacklog

        public int getBacklog()
        the maximum number of connections waiting in the queue maintained by the operating system
        Returns:
        the backlog value

      • setBacklog

        public boolean setBacklog(java.lang.String backlog)
        sets the number of connections that can be queued up if the server socket is busy Not to be kept a number greater than 100 - as it is a OS defined queue
        Parameters:
        backlog - the number of connections to be stored by the operating system
        Returns:
        true if the value passed was a valid number, else false - and backlog is set to default value of 50

      • getRootDir

        public java.io.File getRootDir()
        The root directory that is served by the server if it exists (gets instantiated only when the server starts running) maybe different from the root directory supplied by the config file
        Returns:
        File object of the root directory

      • setRootDir

        public void setRootDir(java.io.File rootDir)
        sets the root directory to the File object supplied and if the directory cannot be executed/read upon the default root("DefaultHome") is served
        Parameters:
        rootDir - the File object that is to be served by the http web server

      • getUploadPath

        public java.lang.String getUploadPath()
        gets the upload directory name
        Returns:
        the valid upload directory name where the files will get stored upon upload

      • setUploadPath

        public boolean setUploadPath(java.lang.String uploadPath)
        Checks the validity of the supplied upload directory and initializes the upload directory variable to default upload path is the suplied value is not a directory
        Parameters:
        uploadPath - the new upload path to set
        Returns:
        true if the directory is valid, else false and sets it to defaultUpload as default upload folder

      • getServerAccepts

        public java.lang.Boolean getServerAccepts()
        tests whether the server is running or not
        Returns:
        true if the server is accepting connections

      • setServerAccepts

        public void setServerAccepts(boolean serverAccepts)
        Sets the server to an accepting state
        Parameters:
        serverAccepts - true if the server is to start accepting incoming connections

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        the port to which the server is bound to
        Returns:
        port value

      • setPort

        public boolean setPort(java.lang.String strPort)
        sets the port to which the server is to be bound to
        Parameters:
        strport - the new port value
        Returns:
        true if the port number is valid to be a port else false -- port checking/binding is not done here

      • getCorePoolSize

        public int getCorePoolSize()
        the number of threads that will be always running at the backend
        Returns:
        the number of core threads

      • setCorePoolSize

        public boolean setCorePoolSize(java.lang.String corePoolSize)
        All changes to pool size must be done before starting the server
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the new pool size
        Returns:
        true if the value provided is a valid one else pool size is set to default - 3 and false is returned

      • getMaxPoolSize

        public int getMaxPoolSize()
        The maximum number of threads the backend can start
        Returns:
        number of maximum poosible/allowed threads

      • setMaxPoolSize

        public boolean setMaxPoolSize(java.lang.String maxPoolSize)
        All changes to pool size must be done before starting the server
        Parameters:
        maxPoolSize - the new pool size
        Returns:
        true if the value provided is a valid one else pool size is set to default - 50 and false is returned

      • getKeepAliveTime

        public long getKeepAliveTime()
        The maximum time a thread is allowed to wait or sit idle
        Returns:
        time in milliseconds

      • setKeepAliveTime

        public boolean setKeepAliveTime(java.lang.String keepAliveTime)
        All changes to keep alive time must be done before starting the server
        Parameters:
        keepAliveTime - new keep alive time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        true if the value provided is a valid one else pool size is set to default - 5000 and false is returned

      • setHomePath

        public boolean setHomePath(java.lang.String homePath)
        Sets the homepath and replaces the OS specific path separators with OS agnostic path separators
        Parameters:
        homePath - the path of the home directory to be served
        Returns:
        true if the value was rightly set to what was provided, else false and default value loaded

      • getHomePath

        public java.lang.String getHomePath()
        Get the home directory path
        Returns:
        home directory separated by OS specific delimiter ('\' or '/')

      • getReqLength

        public int getReqLength()
        gets the maximum length in number of bytes that can be allowed in the headers of a request
        Returns:
        the maximum length of request that can be received by the server ;

      • setReqLength

        public boolean setReqLength(java.lang.String reqLength)
        sets the maximum length in number of bytes that can be allowed in the headers of a request
        Parameters:
        reqLength - the maximum allowed length of a request
        Returns:
        true if the value provided is a valid one else pool size is set to default - 1024 and false is returned

      • createPostPortal

        public void createPostPortal()
        Creates a static HTML page in the home directory to help upload files to the server's upload directory using the browser

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Method binds to the specified port number at the localhost serves the directory provided in the homeDir and initiates the backend with the provided 'numThreads' number of threads with the server socket with the timeout value as specified

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Stops the server threads and the removes the connections from the connection pool
